metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7795 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The manager_invoke_notify_message function in systemd 231 and earlierallows local users to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and PID1 hang) via a zero-length message received over a notify socket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gudev-1.0 - 1:204-5ubuntu20.19
libgudev-1.0-0 - 1:204-5ubuntu20.19
libpam-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-daemon0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-id128-0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-journal0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-login0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libudev1 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
python-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.19
systemd-services - 204-5ubuntu20.19
udev - 204-5ubuntu20.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '204-5ubuntu20.19').
systemd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '204-5ubuntu20.19').
